universalSelector.description: Selects all elements on the page.

typeSelector.description: Selects elements based on their tag name. Example: h1, p, div, etc.

classSelector.description: Selects elements based on their class attribute value. Example: .my-class

idSelector.description: Selects an element based on its unique ID attribute value. Example: #my-id

attributeSelector.description: Selects elements based on their attribute or attribute value.

descendantSelector.description:
Selects elements that are descendants (children, grandchildren, etc.) of another element. Example: div p (selects all

elements inside

elements)

childSelector.description: Selects elements that are direct children of another element. Example: ul > li (selects all <li> elements that are direct children of <ul> elements)

combinators.description: Used to combine multiple selectors. Examples: descendant combinator (div p), child combinator (ul > li), adjacent sibling combinator (h1 + p) general sibling combinator (div ~ p)

selector.description: In CSS, selectors are used to target and select specific HTML elements to apply styles to them.
